history.content:
There is no policy that requires students declare as soon as they complete their last pre-req, however here are some important things to keep in mind:

  • The college will block your registration if you're undeclared for too long (somewhere between 60 & 75 units completed)
  • If you're not declared in CS you will not receive enrollment priority for our UD courses
  • Applications are processed at the end of each semester. If you decide you're ready to declare in February, you will need to wait until after the May 30 deadline to be admitted.'

Just curious what your other major is? Haas?

children.subject:
Hi Nicole,

Thank you so much for your response. My other major is Public Health, and I'm just trying to take a precaution mostly because I've heard of people being rejected due to already having declared another major. Throughout next semester, I'll evaluate the cost-benefits of waiting to declare etc., in regards to receiving enrollment priority and such, but for now, this is my current thought process.

Just one question in follow-up:

1. Does the registration block only take into account units taken at Berkeley? At the end of this semester, I will have around 70 units complete, and around 85 complete at the end of next semester. I plan to declare Public Health in May 2019 (end of Spring semester), and then Computer Science in August 2019 (end of summer semester). Will my registration for Fall 2019 still be blocked then?

history.content:
Hello!

I'm trying to get into a major other than CS that discourages double majoring. As a result, I would rather apply to this major first, and then possibly apply for CS afterwards. I'm going to take CS70 next semester, which will be my last class needed to declare. Is it required to declare by May 30th then? Or can I apply for my other major next semester, and then declare CS at the end of the summer? 

The FAQs said the last semester you finish your technical requirements, but I was wondering how or how strictly this is enforced.

Thank you!
history.subject: Declaring L&S CS Later?
